author: thepeopleperson
title: A good set, but could be better
review:
I bought this set at a lego store for $20, and I am happy with it.  I really like the new analin minifig, but the hair piece looks awkward on other minifigs. Here's a list of pros and cons

minifigs

cons-

author: Rgijaba
title: A good set, but still over rated...
review: before the reveiw, i just wanna say this: THE NEW PEACH SIKINED STAR WARS MINIFIGURES ARE AWSOME!i dont see why anyone wouldnt like them... as for the set, the box is a bit misleading, because on the box Anikan looks realy mad and distubing... but hes realy pretty cool! Aretoo is just as same as always, but on the box his (for some reason) heads on backwords!thats poor building right there. the star fighter is cool, sleek, and the stickers make it less plian and more detailed, but it, sadly, has those  flick fire misles, i mean, WHOS gonna acualy use them?! but at least theyre on the flick fire bricks, so they wont fall out at any angle... the cocpit is strange... the way it just sticks out like that...i dont know how authentic it is, as ive never seen CG animated colne wars, only the 2D one, but LEGO is tepipicly pretty good about those kinda things so its probably authenic. get it if youre a star wars fan, or a LEGO fan, as this is a very good set. BUT STILL OVER RATED!

author: sudorum
title: buy it for the minifig
review: the only reason I bought this set was for the anakin minifigure. In fact, the minifig is the only reason I give this lego a 4 instead of a 3. the ship looks like a clone of the old anakin fighter with the blue vulture droid. the ejection thing for r2 is better than the one with the naboo star fighter but gets jammed easily. Buy this set if you want a rare, detailed minifigure.

author: Loganwan
title: Love it!
review: This is a great design.  I really like how the ship looks when complete.  I would really like to see some others to join the battle.  If I could change any part of these kits, I would add a place to hold a Jedi's lightsaber.  In addition, I would hinge the canopy.  This gives me high hopes for the rest of the 2008 series.

author: David1971
title: Nice, but strangely overpriced
review:
My reaction to this one is affected by the price. For £14.95 it would seem just right, and a very nice set. £12.95 would be even better. But for the actual price of £19.95 (UK) there's not quite enough here.

If we consider another 2008 set, #7621, Indiana Jones and the Lost Tomb - also a Lucasfilm tie-in - it's quite a big thing made of 277 pieces, including two minifigs (plus a skeleton), and it costs £18. Meanwhile this set is a not-very-big spaceship with just one minifig (plus R2D2), and costs £20.

So Lego made a strange choice there. Leaving that aside, this is a nice ship to look at (especially from the back), and the new Anakin minifig is great. The 'ejector seat' for R2D2 isn't great -- at best you can make him plop out of the ship. But it's nice to have a 'hidden' moving-part function.

Basically it's a nice £14 set, and then you are making an additional voluntary contribution of £6 to Lego to support their good work in the community.

author: Manxboi24
title: Great set!
review:
Well, I got this set for my B-day so I'm finally getting around to reviewing it.

Overview:

This set is the first of the anticipated Clone Wars line as is a great one to start with.  It contains 153 pieces and costs $19.99 here in the US.

The Build:

The build takes roughly 20 minutes and is surprisingly different to that of the set 7143 Jedi Starfighter.  During this fun build, the only down side is having to attach all of stickers (such as one the tail and the yellow SNOT at the front.

Minifigs:

This set comes with 2 minifigs - R2-D2 and Anakin Skywalker.  There's nothing new about R2, just the same cute but standard droid as seen in many other sets.  The Anakin minifig is in cartoon form which looks slightly weird but you get used to it.  

Fighter:

The fighter itself is very cool and looks really good.  Under where R2 is placed, there is a little lever with you and push and the poor droid is pushed out of the fighter (providing you apply the right amount of pressure).  Under the wings, LEGO has once again managed to include the flick fire missiles.  This variety is, however, different to those we saw last year and are better at staying in place.  Although you'd except them to be the same size, this fighter is smaller than the version that we saw in 03 but not by much.  Overall, the fighter is pretty good and has some interesting features.

Summary:

I'd recommend anyone who's a fan of PT to get this set as it is loaded with cool features.  Very swooshable!  4.5/5!

author: Leggodt94
title: Clone Wars set NO. 1
review:
Personaly, I think that this set is great! It's a nice set that gets back to the basics of jedi starfighter design. With that said, let's jump into some pros and cons: 

    Pros: 
      -comes with new interesting anakin minifig 
      -is designed with new, neat movie-accurate drop system 
      -is easy to build

    Cons:

      -no cool way to open wind shield (not a big deal) 
      

Over all, a great set that I would highly recommend getting. Clone Wars sets start off great!

Okay I got this set for 15.00 which is pretty good for the set. The ship is a big improvement on the old one and makes a nice ship. Also you finally have a full R2-D2 for his ship. On the flipside Anakin has a good outfit on but his face is weird! It looks like scars on chapped lips! I have goten used to it and the hairpiecee is okay, but it only fits town minifigs and that's about it. 
Pro:

Cons:

Really that's the only bad part but I only give it a 5/5 for the cool ship.

author: Gus_263
title: Cool Starfighter
review: This set is one of the Star Wars sets and is from this year, part of the Clone Wars subtheme. The set is good in the design, building and too in th pieces. The two minifigures included are the R2-D2 minifigure, that is good with the correct shape of the R2 and also good with the details and pieces. The Anakin minifigure in this set is customized to looks like the Anakin of the Clone Wars, and the details of the body are good like the original lightsaber. The anakin's head is nice detailed, but the eyes are not in a good style, makes it looks like more exo force and the scars aren't in a good size. Another thing that this minifigure have that can be better is the hair, due to the shape and color, this brown is not the best for it, altough the anakin of the Clone Wars have this color of the hair. The Jedi Starfighter features some characteristics of the Star Wars sets of space ships, like the missiles, in good style and color but with bad building, don't works very well, altough the position is right. Another characteristic of the current star wars spaceships sets is the landing gears, that like the other works very well. The base of the starfighter is good builted and it have some characteristics of the building of the Obi Wan's delta 7 starfighter set, released in 2002 as one of the episode 2 sets, the Jedi Starfighter. The wings (not exactly wings), have some limitations to the movements, but it works well due to the spaceship still in a better style. The cockpit is simple and the figure stays in it also very well. The minifigure of R2 stays in this Jedi starfighter too and it is good positioned. On the back, some pieces are used to looks like turbos, and these are good like the "flag" piece, that have a part hidden, to it looks like exactly the aerodinamic back of the delta 7 style Jedi starfighter. The front is very simple and made with few plates and few stickers. Altough the set is good builted, the front is so much simple in comparison with other starfighters and this starfighter is more small due to it. Overall a good set,  useful pieces, but the minifigure style can be better and too for the front building, like the sides, so much simple to a set with this size, including few plates and making a boring building, but still cool to play with. So, this nice set can be better in some things.

review: this is a nice set. i like how the r2d2 unit pops out. this comes with 2 missiles, a freaky anakin and a droid lets go to the pros and cons pros:lunching missiles, light saber, two minifigs, easy to build, lots of yellow bricks. now its time for the cons: cockpit dose not open, droid blocks the front, and stickers over all great set.

Pros:

author: MandalorianCandidate
title: This little set has swooshability
review:
Anakin's Jedi Starfighter is the preview set for the Clone Wars Lego line, as was the original 7143 Jedi Starfighter (2002) for the AOTC Lego line.  Having seen first hand much of the CW sets released in August, I'd say Lego set the bar high with this edition then failed to clear it.

I'll start off by saying that I really dig this starfighter.  Just a nice addition to the Lego SW collection.  The design of the set is lifted closely from 7143 but there are many improvements.  First off we get two minifigs instead of the one (Pilot Obi-Wan) and the R5-D4 droid dome.  This is because of the droid socket that was designed into the CW ship, which holds the included R2-D2.  Although most older collectors probably have plenty of R2s, the younger crowd may not have him yet.  I suppose this isn't Lego's fault (the droid dome vs. full on droid) as the ship from AOTC was designed to have a fully integrated droid (although the EP3 JSF did have the droid dome and the movie version has the pop-out droid socket).  Still, for a $20 set there should be at least two minifigs.  

I like that Lego/Lucasfilm kept the Anakin ship color consistent between EP1, EP3, and now the CW toons (it was blue and white in the original CW).  That being said, the yellow color plays off nicely with the dark blay (bluish gray) of the wings.  It also adds to some easy modding as it shouldn't be that hard to find replacement parts in other color schemes for other Jedi Knights (I was able to scrounge up some dark red pieces from bricklink for an OB1 fighter and some dark blue pieces for another Jedi).

The pop-out socket is kind of neat but it doesn't quite get R2 out of the socket, but I score Lego high for the effort.  The two flick fire missiles are an improvement over 7143, which had none.  I also like that the front of the ship is fully integrated into the structure unlike the 7143, which was a clip on.  Besides the stickers (five of them, grrrrr), my only real complaint is that the rudder/flag element is attached to the fuselage by one clip brick instead of in two places on the 7143, making it less stable. At least the stickers are see-through, allowing modders to put them on differently colored pieces and letting just the foreground be seen.  Oh yeah, the creepy minifig face.  Don't dig it at all.  I like the different hair piece but the CW-style face has gotta go.  I'm hoping they won't carry over to non-CW minifigs.

There are some interesting parts, like the 4x4 circular plate, the rare 1x12 plates, and all the wing tiles.



One last note.  I'm surprised that the JSF has a lower rating that the Magnaguard ship and the V-19.  I'm thinking that many are equating quality with price, which is never an automatic correlation.  The rest of the CW sets to me are either OK or are kind of a waste of money (**cough**twilight**cough).  With this set I thought we'd be getting some nice stuff at a reasonable price.  I suppose whether we did or not is up to debate, but I think Lego did a nice job at getting the hype up by delivering well with this first CW entry.

Borrowing the rating method from fbtb.net...

price/parts ratio - 4/10
parts selection - 8/10
minifigs - 6/10
construction - 8/10
design/sturdiness - 8/10
comparison to film/TV - 9/10
swoosh factor - 8/10
reviewer's tilt - 8/10
FINAL SCORE - 7.4/10 ==> 4 of 5

author: hustla187
title: Don't Compare to Obi Wan's Jedi Starfighter
review: I have heard people that compared this set to the Jedi Starfighter with Obi Wan in 2002. There is a complete difference between the two. First, Anakin's face needs to be different. author: Obi_Wan9994
title: The Clone Wars Rage on in Space!
review:
I got this today, and I think it's great.

Pros:
New Anakin mini fig- really cool, comes with blue lightsaber with gray hilt.
R2-D2
Cockpit- has contols and a spot for Anakin, window piece must be pulled off to get inside. Not enough space for lightsaber(I added a piece to the underside of the cockpit to hold it).
Slot for R2 to sit in while in flight. Unfortunately, when the ship turns past 90 degrees, R2 slips out, but I customized it, and now R2 stays in place.
2 flick fire missles- stay in place well, I'm not usually a fan, but these ones are kind of cool.
Nice size
Accurate
Good pieces- you don't get tons of Technic pieces, it's mostly bricks
Good Price- completely worth it.
Great Playability- this set goes well with the Hailfire droid set, and of course, with all Star Wars sets.
easy to build, doesn't take long.
Good(not great, unless you add stickers) detail.
One of the less expensive Clone Wars sets(this is one of the only ones I'll get).

Cons:
Stickers- I HATE THEM! But you don't need to use them. :) 

I recommend this to All Star Wars fans, if you aren't one, then I don't think you'd like this very much.

review: I bought this set drove home and built it. For first look it was impressive with all those flick firing missiles and R2-D2 flopping out. But then it started to be boring. although it had blue lightsaber new style Anakin and R2.

author: MayTheBricksBeWithYou
title: Great swoosh factor!
review:
This was my first LEGO buy since a long time, but it sure is the start of a new LEGO era for me. But enough of that, this set:

Build was very easy and fast, some nice new parts (for me than) to work with and I really love that little landing gear up front which goes right into the belly of the ship. The R2D2 eject button is a nice touch and after a little practice works like a charm. The flick-fire-missiles are a nice addition as well. 

The Pro's:
+ Great shape when seen from above
+ Landing gear is awesome
+ R2D2 eject is nice addition.
+ Overall great design and true to the show.

The Con's
- No space for the lightsaber
- That sloped grey brick in between the front sloped and the rounded near the cockpit is rough instead of smooth. This breaks the design for my taste. 
- The rear could have been better.

But even with these cons, I still love the set and it's a 4+ for sure!

author: johndies222
title: Good For Kids
review:
This Set was okay but you can see that it was more intended for young kids than adults. I do like the size of it and how it maintains a close appearance to the fighter in the shows.The price for this item is fairly reasonable and Lego tried to limit the amount of cheap gimmicks in the set. Unfortunately this set has stickers and the not so great flick fire missiles. I do like the R2 push button that tries to push R2 out of the ship. It isn't perfect but it works.

    Pro's:
      - The likeness is good.
      - The ship is of a good size for children to play with or for collectors who wish to display it.
      - It is very sturdy and doesn't fall to pieces.
      - The price is reasonable

   Con's:
      - Stickers!
      - The not so great flick fire.
      - The R2 pop out device doesn't work every time unless you work with it some.

    Truly the biggest problem would be stickers and that is still not much to deter how good this set is.

author: _add_um
title: Nice Starfighter
review: This is a really great set. I love the yellow colour scheme and starfighter is nice and solid. You get 2 minifigs R2-D2 and Anakin Skywalker, R2-D2 is the same the other R2-D2s in prevous sets but the Anakin is brand new and is based off The Clone Wars TV Series, so the minifig gets an cartoony look. Unlike other people I actually like the minifig's face, saying that I would have preferred a regual looking face. Its sad to see the classic chome lightsaber is gone, the plain grey ones are pretty boring. The new flick-fire missiles are a awesome inprovement over the other ones released back in 2006 and 2007 sets. The mechanism that pops R2-D2 is pretty pointless and dosn't always work. The set also includes stickers but they don't overlap lego pieces. The starfighter also has 3 legs to stand it which are very sturdy. Its look exactly like way it appears in show and it goes great with other Clone Wars sets. Overall I really like the set and should be added to your Star Wars collection. 9/10!!

author: Jon_Brick
title: Anakin's Delta 7b Jedi Starfighter
review:
Ahhh, it's nice that lego made a starfighter for Anakin that goes with Obi-wan's old jedi starfighter (it was kind of weird having Anakin's jedi interceptor in one hand and having Obi-wan's jedi starfighter in the other). While some of lego's sets are overpriced these days it's nice to have a cheap sturdy set like this.

pros:
Clone Wars Anakin in a cheap set
low price good build
missiles

cons:
astromech ejection button is lame
should have come with R3-S6

Thanks for reading, lenjonxiii

(sorry if the review is lame it's my first in months)

author: DevDevBeck
title: This is one of the Worst lego sets ever!
review:
This is a Anikan's Jedi starfighter from the Star Wars: The Clone Wars TV series. The ship has flick fire missiles, an R2-D2 launch feature, and a detailed underside.

The Minifigures:
R2 D2 is a good and rare addition to the set. A good R2 figure is hard to fiind now.
The Anikan Minifigure is a DISGRACE. Why did lego change the mini figures? The Anakin figure from the 2006 sets was much better. And where did he get the scars that are on his face? I mean, I haven't seen the TV series, but I guess Lego just wanted to make him look more dramatic, but if you ask me, they FAILED.

The Ship:
Anakin's Jedi starfighter itself has a good overall design, but it lacks in quality. The R2 launch feature doesn't work, and you practically need to slam your fist to get it to work anyway. When it does work, it launches him very high into the air and he will never land on his legs. Plus, the hollow space in the middle of the fighter where the launch mechanism is causes the middle section to collapse on it. On the bottom, there are some flick fire missles, but you can't flck them becuase there are too many parts in the way! Why did they switch to flick fire missiles anyway? I think that was a dumb move.

All in all, this set is terrible. Don't het it unless you want some of the pieces. I made the mistake of choosing this over a Star Wars video game, which I now regret.

author: legoreviewer
title: Suprisingly Awsome!
review:
When I first saw this set, I was thinking it looked kinda lame. But I saw it on the store shelf and there were no other good sets out at the time so I went ahead and bought it along with Ahsoka's Jedi Starfighter. I was very im pressed with the design and overall look of the set. I mainly got it for R2-D2 and anakin but as it turned out the set was really good.

Minifigs: R2-D2 I didn't have so I got this set for him and Anakin both as an addition to my Republic army. So the minifigs are greatbut Anakin looks pretty scary eith his scars. Ugh..

Build: Simple and easy. Took me about 25 min. to finish. This set would be nice for beginners due to the fun and easy build.

Finished Product: Looks pretty cool and the landing gear works very well. But the R2-D2 launching function is suckish unless you pretty much slam the set.

Overall: A great set and the launching function is the only problem but it's no big deal. Very nice set. Get it before it sells out!! 5/5

author: TheDarkKnight
title: A Set That Takes You To "a galaxy far, far away..."
review:
Introduction: Well, this is a pretty nice set. Not the best in the world, but worth the $25 price tag, I'd say. There's a really nice piece selection, and, while not being the best, it gives a few nice yellow pieces and yields a small amount of useful technic pieces. Also, I haven't seen the trans-blue cones in a while, so that was nice.

 

Packaging: What better place to start than what you first see, in fact, the only thing you see until the boc is opened. The box is pretty nice, but is comes complete with those new flaps that are ruining the LEGO Company's boxes. The box art is nice, and despite what others are saying, the new Clone Wars figures may differentiate from "normal" Star Wars minifigures, but however "ugly" they may be, they do resemble the new cartoon characters a lot and I respect that the LEGO Company is keeping up its standards in that respect. The "old" R2-D2 is included here in this set, as this was released in 2007 as a "trial" Clone Wars set along with Hailfire and Spider Droid.

 

Minifigures: Only two in this set, but they're suitable. Who else? The title, of course, is Anakin's Starfighter, so it does make sense to include the title character. And, by the way, I don't care what anyone else says, Anakin and Padme will never be as close and Anakin and Artoo. Never. R2-D2 is his same old self, and by old, I mean the previous version with the white head with the silver stripe around the head and the detailing that looks vaguely like the movie. He has a nice design, as he has since his first outing in 2000, but I do sincerely wish that he were a little shorter. He really stacks up against normal minifigs, but that's pretty much unpreventable given that his conception came around the same time as the first AT-ST. That one that looked like... I don't know. Anakin... This is where the set, all sets with "Clone Wars" Anakin drop the ball: His face and hair are perfect, spot-on, beautiful. Then... the body. The torso is just.... weird. The actual Clone Wars Anakin has a sort of dark blue torso and crimson arms. Why LEGO felt the need to change this to black and brown, I don't know. But, while not fitting as a piece of Clone Wars merchandise, it is a perfectly acceptable LEGO minifigure. The detailing on the torso is pretty nice. Not very accurate, but nice. Overall, I'd give the minifigures a solid 4.5 out of 5.

 

The Vehichle: Wow. After my rambling about the minifigs, that's about all I can say. This thing tops the original (Episode II) so much, starting with the glorious fact that the wings bend! Yup, you got it: The wings bend. Man, I was so happy to know that it's not even funny. Love it. I don't really care for the way the back was designed, but other than that, it's nice.

 

The Build: Very nice. Sturdy, holds together even after a drop on carpet. I didn't actually test it on purpose, but, y'know, things happen. I really, really, really (no matter what anyone else says) loved the Artoo popping-mechanism. It's just awesome and very creative. Fortunately, if built right, it works almost every time; but if it doesn't, that's not a reason to come on here and complain. Maybe gripe, but some reviews are just pitiful. I'm sorry, I just can't abide it. Anyways, enough of my self-indulgent rambling.

 

Overall: A very nice set with a minifigure selection that's pretty nice. Good job, LEGO, I'm lovin' it! (much more than McDonald's. *shudder*)

author: penguin999
title: a jedi can fly too
review:
This set is a great set for any jedi or clone wars fan. the minifigs are great as well. You get a clone wars Anakin with a new and double torso plus new hair and a lightsaber. Also includes R2-D2 which can fit in front of the cockpit to help Anakin navigate or pilot. Also you can push a button on the back to make R2 jump in the air but this does not work at all. The cockpit is not that big and hardly has room for his elbows but it does have a detailed control panel. It has nice engines and flap on the end. There is also missles under the wings and directly above are the laser cannons. look at the pitcher above and see the light grey piece attached to the missle....it looks stupid right? so I just moved it further back so it is hidden. And lastly one of the best parts of the set is the landing gear. It has 3 landing feet which fold in and out of really good.

pros: landing gear
        minifigs
        missles

cons:
        small cockpit
         no buzz droids?
        laser cannons not look like laser cannons

overall this is a fair set and i would recommend it for youger builders

author: Z_wing
title: at least its not the same as 7143
review:
many people complain that that the jedi starfighter in set 7751 is almost the same as this set. this set could of been the same as 7143. but good old lego made sure it wasn't.

figures

cons: both can be found in other sets

ship
pros: flick fire missiles, r2 ejection button, landing gear
cons: is not 100% airtight, cockpit cannot open

pieces
pros: yellow flag piece at the back
cons: none

build
pros: easy, strong
cons: none

price
pros: not too expensive
cons: should be £5 cheaper

I recommend this set to lego star wars fans

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Star Wars - Anakin's Jedi Starfighter Review
review:
This is one of my first and only sets which I got with an Anakin Skywalker minifigure in clone wars style. The set is a great built and we also get a R2-D2 minifig but this droid is not a special character because you'll find him in lot's of sets of the LEGO Star Wars theme. The Anakin's Jedi Starfighter set comes with a lightsaber for Anakin as well.

The cool play feature of this set is that you're able to shoot out R2 if you push the button on the back. This space ship also comes with flick-missiles. After I built this set there was one sticker left which I think was odd because I normally don't have extra stickers when I build my sets. So I decided to put this sticker on the back of the windscreen.

All in all this set is a great model and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de


Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

There are these two flick fire missles undernieth the ship that you can barely reach. And theres a button on the back to make r2-d2 pop out of his likkle hole. author: LEGOwikiguy
title: Anakin's fighter flies out of the Clone Wars...so that's where this set is from...
review:
This set was released too early in my opinion (People didn't know it was for "The Clone Wars" then). But LEGO made a little teaser for it...good for them. The two figures are good: A new Anakin (Animated, but better facial details) and the same old R2-D2. Price is not bad (Not saying its good though). You probably won't see this coming: Pros and Cons! Ok, you probably saw it coming:

Pros:

1. R2-D2 fits in front

2. Fighter has nice details

3. Not too many stickers (A few)

4. Sturdy, doesn't usually fall apart

Cons:

1. R2 doesn't pop out all of the way! 

2. Too big compared to Ahsoka's fighter

3. Hard to flick flick-fire missles at the bottom

4. Very limited playability really...

Parents: This is a pretty easy build for a child over 8 years old. Help will most likely not be really necessary. 3/5 is my rating.

You are not able to Anakin in the cockpit with his lightsaber, and the yellow square at the back of the ship is kind of hard to put in. Other than that, it's 5/5!

Yellow sqare hard to put in

author: tkettle9719
title: The only Jedi Starfighter I ever wanted (I don't want duplicates).
review:
I got this set for my birthday from my best friend in 6th grade, and am glad that I made the choice that, although the massive amounts of Jedi Starfighters are way too plentiful, I still like to display and play with.

Pros

  • -Color scheme: Grays and yellow are a heaven-made match for this ship.
  • -The inclusion of play features, such as the R2-D2 release or missiles, are nice .
  • …

Cons

  • -The lightsaber in this set has no place to go, unlike Plo Koon's Starfighter.
  • -There's also many things called stickers in this set, and I hate them with a passion; they're pesky, annoying, and just there to detract value from the set.
  • …

This set can definitely hope to stay in my collection for a while, because of looks, play, and everything else. I recommend this set, but do take note of the cons.

author: psychman7
title: Star Wars Set #15: 7669 Anakin's Jedi Starfighter
review:
A popular starfighter in the Clone Wars TV series, this is a pretty solid starfighter. It's fast, it's sleek, and it's something I would want to fly.

Box/Instructions:
A square box, so not too much to say. Anakin must really be winning this battle. The instructions are pretty much like any other. Darth Vader's still creepin' in the corner.

The Pieces:
Pretty much any pieces you would find in a Jedi starfighter. The cockpit piece is unique, and so are the Technic pieces, which are obviously used for the R2-D2 ejection mechanism. The flick-missiles are obviously new to the Star Wars line at this point, even though they are super popular now. Also unique is the flag piece and the 2x2 cylinder tile with the Republic logo printed onto it.

The Stickers:
The set includes six stickers: Two on the nose, two on the flag piece, and two tiny Republic symbols on the slopes by the flag. The starfighter really comes to life with these.

The Minifigures:
The two expected minifigures of the set are two good ones...at least at the time. Anakin Skywalker, Clone Wars style is pretty good. The older R2-D2 is also included, but they've improved on his design since then.

The Jedi Starfighter:
I really like this ship. It's fast, it's sleek, and it just looks cool. The ejection mechanism is built pretty much towards the beginning-middle of the build. To be completely honest, it's pretty weak. He doesn't go out into space very far. It only works effectively if you push the little blue button at the back just right. Moving into the build, you put together the cockpit and the functioning landing gear. Considering the landing gear is only made from two pieces each, it's hidden quite well when folded up. The wings are well detailed with really cool patterns by use of the yellow pieces. Completing the look is the yellow flag at the back, which must be some kind of stabilizing fin.

The Final Verdict:
Pieces - 10/10 - A great use for wing pieces, and the unique ones look good.
Stickers - 10/10 - Great stickers, and give the ship a good look.
Minifigures - 8/10 - R2 sucks.
Jedi Starfighter - 10/10 - The design rocks, it's sleek...it's just awesome.

Final Result - 9.5/10. It's a fantastic ship that's fun to fly around.

author: bricksaber
title: Happy 10th Anniversary Clone Wars!
review:
This year marks the 10th anniversary of Star Wars The Clone Wars and as both a member of the show's crew and a big AFOL I wanted to highlight a couple sets to mark the occasion.

First a little background on me. I worked on the entire run of CW starting as the coordinator of the design department and ending as the script and continuity assistant production manager (I like to think of it as a long title for 'big nerd'). It had been a life long dream to work on Star Wars and I did pretty much everything there, I know I am lucky. During that time I was always playing around with my Lego so no one was more excited than me to see the first official piece of merchandise was a Lego set of Anakin's Jedi Starfighter.

Box Design

I don't know if this set was the first but I know there can't be many sets that have 2 completely different box designs. Though the red Vader version was technically first, I prefer the Clone Wars branded blue and white box.

Minifigures

This is the most disappointing aspect of the set for me and for many others I am sure. It wasn't the number of minfigs or who were included but how they were designed. I have no idea why it was decided to change the basic look of the minifig faces in the Clone Wars sets but it was a terrible. Instantly, Clone Wars became separate from the rest of Star Wars which was a huge mistake the line could never shake. A fact this AFOL took particularly hard since I also happened to work on the only other show where the minifig faces were altered (Avatar). I am glad the latest Clone Wars sets have since corrected this.

The Build

Though the build was fairly simple, I enjoyed it. The set did a good job capturing the look of Anakin's ship with few stickers and the fun R2 socket play feature.

Overall

This wasn't the best Clone Wars set but it was a good one, especially as the first one ever. It was a dream come true to be a part of the Star Wars mythos and I am very proud that people still enjoy the show today. And if the rumors are true, I can't wait to see how Lego does a new version of Anakin's Jedi Starfighter.

I will be doing another Clone Wars review soon, for my favorite set and will talk a little more how the subject matter came about. Stay tuned!

author: kingtrotalot
title: Love it!
review:
I'd just like to say that im a huge fan of the clone wars series and i love the starships in it but this tops them all , well except the arc fighter.

Box/Instructions

the box is a decent size and the cover art is looks brilliant

Parts

the are really nicely made and really fit with the theme of the set and of course there's the classic republic emblem and they even put it in the right place!

Minifigures

the minifigures are pretty well designed and fit nicely inside their compartments 

The build

the build is for about a adept builder so most people with a bit lego skill under there belt should be able to do this but if your new to lego sets then try some simpler sets first

The completed model

the completed model looks pretty good on display and can go with plenty other sets that could become an epic dogfight!

Overall opinion

this set is brilliant for the amid collector and goes perfect with any clone wars display .
